tweet: As your congresswoman, and as DHS Appropriations Chairwoman, I'll keep fighting for policies that protect the dignity and well-being of migrants, and will do all I can to oppose President Trump's anti-immigrant cruelty and bigotry. #ImmigrantHeritageMonth

During this #ImmigrantHeritageMonth, I've proudly led the House in passing the #DreamAndPromiseAct to protect our #Dreamers and #TPS/#DED holders, and introducing the HELP Separated Children and Help Separated Families Acts to help migrant children and #KeepFamiliesTogether.

I'm proud to represent the rich diversity of #CA40, including immigrants and descendants of immigrants from countless lands. #ImmigrantHeritageMonth is a time to remember that immigrants have strengthened America's economy, communities, and values throughout our history.

As we keep fighting for the #EqualityAct and other policies to protect the rights, dignity and well-being of our #LGBTQ community, we honor the story and legacy of those who ignited the Stonewall uprising. #Stonewall50

On this #Stonewall50 anniversary, let's also reaffirm that the battle for #LGBTQ rights is far from over. @HouseDemocrats have passed the #EqualityAct to ensure no one can be fired, evicted, or denied service because of their sexual orientation or gender identity.

Today, we mark the 50-year anniversary of the uprising at New York City's Stonewall Inn, which helped pave the way for the growing visibility, empowerment, and embrace of our #LGBTQ community in the decades since. #Stonewall50

America’s #Dreamers shouldn’t have to live in terror that #SCOTUS will finish Trump's dismantling of #DACA. The House already passed #HR6, my #DreamAndPromiseAct – it’s past time for the Senate to take it up and protect our neighbors, friends, and communities. #ProtectTheDream https://twitter.com/nytimes/status/1144601411864469505 …
I'm looking for college and graduate students to intern in my Commerce district office this summer:  https://bit.ly/2KLQaS4  pic.twitter.com/Lu042w1ew7

We must do more than provide funding to help migrant children and families -- we must make sure we have rigorous standards in place that protect their health, safety, and dignity. That is what I will keep fighting for every day as DHS Appropriations Chairwoman.
House Democrats’ border supplemental had strong standards of care for migrant children, and policies to process migrants humanely. Mitch McConnell wasn't interested.
I voted against the Senate border supplemental because Mitch McConnell TOTALLY failed to do his job and did not include protections for the children at our nation’s borders.
While this #SCOTUS ruling on #Census2020 is a victory for our nation, our House Democratic Majority will stay vigilant, and fight any further efforts to sabotage a fair and accurate 2020 #Census.

An accurate and complete #Census2020 is essential to ensuring our communities receive the federal funds we need for countless critical programs, including Medicare and Medicaid, school lunches, highway funding, housing assistance, and more.
Trump is eager to silence the voices of vulnerable populations in our communities – that’s why he wanted a #Census2020 #CitizenshipQuestion that will dramatically undercount these populations.

VICTORY!  #SCOTUS has turned back Trump’s unconstitutional attempt to add a #CitizenshipQuestion to #Census2020. This ruling is a victory for an accurate, comprehensive, and complete Census count. https://twitter.com/latimes/status/1144255322305028096 …

#MarriageEquality, decriminalizing same-sex couples, and overturning DOMA. 3 important #SCOTUS decisions in the last 20 years, all on June 26th. Let’s take #PrideInProgress we’ve made towards #LGBTQ equality, and make June 26th #LGBTQEqualityDay across America. pic.twitter.com/PHFpqGDOMS

Our supplemental addresses humanitarian needs including food, shelter, medical care & legal aid; compels the Trump Admin to treat migrants w/dignity & care; and limits the Admin's power to grossly misuse these funds for anti-immigrant policies. Read more: https://bit.ly/2ILKSUB

I applaud the House for passing our crucial bill to protect migrant children and families at our southern border.  As a mother and grandmother, I am heartbroken by the suffering these children and families are facing in the Trump Administration’s custody. pic.twitter.com/DKcxTE2lCC

I stand with my fellow Democrats in supporting the restoration of the #VotingRightsAct, and protecting every eligible American's ability to get their ballot cast and counted. #RestoreTheVote #ForThePeople

Six years ago, SCOTUS gutted the #VotingRightsAct in Shelby County v. Holder. Our #DHS bill also makes crucial investments across the spectrum of homeland security missions—protecting our physical infrastructure & cybersecurity; securing our territorial waters & airspace; and helping our state & local govts get ready to face terrorist threats & disasters.

The @AppropsDems' #DHS funding bill takes a balanced approach to border security and immigration enforcement, including vigorous efforts to address the humanitarian crisis at our southern border, and to ensure fair and humane treatment for everyone in our government's custody.

Our FY 2020 @AppropsDems #HomelandSecurity bill includes $12 billion for the #CoastGuard, with significant increases to support the @USCG workforce and invest in critical marine and air assets.

BIG NEWS: The House just passed #HR6, the #DreamAndPromiseAct! I'm proud to co-lead this bill to protect our #Dreamers and #TPS/#DED recipients, and provide them a path to citizenship. Our country and economy are stronger thanks to the contributions of these amazing Americans.

The House is voting NOW on the #DreamAndPromiseAct, the bill I've co-led to protect America's incredible #Dreamers & #TPS/#DED recipients and offer them a path to citizenship. I'm voting for #HR6 because these talented American patriots should have a place in our nation’s future.
